rules: Rule1: Article X is either approved for publication or meets platform guidelines
Rule2: If Article X is scheduled for release, then it will not be published immediately
Rule3: If Article X is held for editing, then it will not be published immediately
Rule4: Either editor review is completed for Article X or copy editing is required
Rule5: If copy editing is required for Article X, then it will be held for editing
Rule6: If disciplinary action is taken regarding Article X, then no procedure violation is reported
Rule7: If executive approval is granted for Article X, then priority status is assigned
Rule8: If Article X receives fast track processing, then it meets platform guidelines
Rule9: If limited distribution is approved for Article X, then it is published with restrictions
Rule10: If full publication is authorized for Article X, then it meets platform guidelines
Rule11: If hold is lifted from Article X, then a distribution hold was previously placed
Rule12: If release decision is made for Article X, then it is either scheduled for release or held for editing
Rule13: If manual review is required for Article X, then should it be flagged for review, it will not be approved for publication
Rule14: Either manual review is required for Article X or automated review is triggered
Rule15: If senior editor is assigned to Article X, then under the condition that automated review triggering does not lead to flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved
Rule16: Either senior editor is assigned to Article X or junior editor is assigned
Rule17: If junior editor is assigned to Article X, then whenever automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved
Rule18: Should neither copyright verification occur nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevent citation check completion, then legal department is notified

Rule19: Provided that neither copyright verification occurs nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevents citation check completion, then legal department is not notified
Rule20: If standard procedure following does not result in editor review completion leading to scheduled release, then procedure violation is reported
Rule21: Whenever standard procedure following does not lead to editor review completion resulting in scheduled release, disciplinary action is taken
Rule22: If priority status assignment does not result in fast track processing, then status review is required
Rule23: Provided that neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization happens, then hold is lifted
Rule24: Whenever neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization occurs, then no distribution hold is placed
Rule25: If final approval giving does not lead to release decision making, then approval is escalated
Rule26: Under the condition that final approval giving does not result in release decision making, approval is not escalated
Rule27: Provided that automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, then content is not approved
Rule28: If non-guideline compliance does not result in plagiarism detection, then citation check is completed
Rule29: If Article X does not meet platform guidelines, then it is published immediately
facts: Fact1: Standard procedure is followed for Article X
Fact2: Article X is flagged for review
Fact3: Executive approval is granted for Article X
Fact4: Final approval is given for Article X
Fact5: Copyright is not verified for Article X
Fact6: Status review is not required for Article X
Fact7: Article X is not published with restrictions
Fact8: Plagiarism is not detected in Article X
